intro: Staphisagria moschata, commonly known as the musk root, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its root system is the primary part used for medicinal purposes. Staphisagria moschata is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, woodland habitats.
